memberdef.name: builtin_double
memberdef.initializer: = { { basic_cos, "COS" }, { basic_getvar_real, "GETVARR" }, { basic_pow, "POW" }, { basic_realval, "REALVAL" }, { basic_sin, "SIN" }, { basic_tan, "TAN" }, { basic_sqrt, "SQRT" }, { basic_sqrt, "SQR" }, { basic_atan, "ATAN" }, { basic_atan2, "ATAN2" }, { basic_ceil, "CEIL" }, { basic_round, "ROUND" }, { basic_fmod, "FMOD" }, { basic_asn, "ASN" }, { basic_acs, "ACS" }, { basic_exp, "EXP" }, { basic_log, "LOG" }, { basic_deg, "DEG" }, { basic_rad, "RAD" }, { NULL, NULL }, }

briefdescription.para: Begins parsing a function's comma-separated parameter list.

detaileddescription.para: This function initializes the context for parsing a list of parameters, setting up necessary variables to process function arguments passed to a procedure or function.

parameterdescription.para: The function definition containing the parameter list.

briefdescription.para: Extracts a parameter from a comma-separated list in a function.

detaileddescription.para: This function extracts individual parameters from a function's comma-separated argument list and processes them based on their type.

parameterdescription.para: The function definition containing the parameter list.

simplesect.para: uint8_t 1 if more parameters are present, 0 otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Evaluate a string function in the context of BASIC.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the function to evaluate.

simplesect.para: The evaluated string result of the function.

briefdescription.para: Check if a function name is a builtin function returning an integer value, if it is, call its handler and set its return value.

detaileddescription.para: Check if a function name corresponds to a built-in integer function.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to return value of function

briefdescription.para: Check if a function name corresponds to a built-in double (floating-point) function.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the function to check.
Pointer to store the result of the function if found.

simplesect.para: 1 if the function is found and executed, 0 otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Check if a function name is a builtin function returning a string, if it is, call its handler and set its return value.

detaileddescription.para: Check if a function name corresponds to a built-in string function.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to return value of function

briefdescription.para: Evaluate an integer function in the context of BASIC.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the function to evaluate.

simplesect.para: The evaluated integer result of the function.

briefdescription.para: Evaluate a double (floating-point) function in the context of BASIC.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the function to evaluate.
Pointer to store the evaluated result of the function.

briefdescription.para: Parse function definitions in the BASIC program.

simplesect.para: True if the function definitions were parsed successfully, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Find a function definition by name in the BASIC context.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the function to find.

simplesect.para: The function definition if found, NULL otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Free function definitions and associated resources in the BASIC context.
Check if a function name corresponds to a built-in double (floating-point) function.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the function to check.

simplesect.para: True if the function is a built-in double function, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Handles the PROC statement in BASIC, used for calling a procedure.

detaileddescription.para: The PROC statement calls a procedure that has been previously defined.

briefdescription.para: Handles the DEF statement in BASIC, used for function or procedure definitions.

detaileddescription.para: The DEF statement is used to define a function or a procedure in BASIC. It processes the definition and parameter list.

briefdescription.para: Handles the = statement in BASIC, used to return a value from a FN.

detaileddescription.para: The = character as a statement returns a value from a function.

briefdescription.para: Handles the ENDPROC statement in BASIC, used for returning from a procedure.

detaileddescription.para: The ENDPROC statement is used to return control from a procedure to the calling location.
